intro: Galium mite var. angustissimum, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
